column3: Description
column11: Description

column3: This database consists of a shapefile storing the geometry of buildings in the zone of analysis. This database is useful to calculate the geometry and position of buildings, and as such, it is a key element in all CEA.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Building total height above ground
Building total height below ground
Number of building floors above ground
Number of building floors below  ground

column3: This database consists of a shapefile storing the geometry of buildings in the surroundings of the zone of analysis. This database is useful to calculate the radiation reflected from surrounding buildings into the zone of analysis.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Building total height above ground
Building total height below ground
Number of building floors above ground
Number of building floors below  ground
Time stamp for each day of the year ascending in hour intervals.
Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Describes the occupancy in terms of pax, an estimate number of people, for a given hour time stamp.
Sensible heat load of the heating system
Latent heat load of the heating system

column3: This database consists of a .dbf file storing the age of construction and years of renovation of different architectural components in buildings in the zone of analysis. This database is useful to estimate embodied and grey energy and emissions due to the construction and retrofit of buildings.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.

column3: This database consists of a .dbf file storing architectural properties of buildings in the zone of analysis. This database is useful to calculate the thermal properties of the building envelope and occupancy density, and as such, it is a key element in all CEA.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Share of floors with an open envelope (default = 0)
Fraction of gross floor area air-conditioned.
Average window-to-wall area ratio in the cardinal direction x
Air exchanges per hour at a pressure of 50 Pa.
Roof construction type (relates to values in Default Database Construction Properties)
Wall construction type ÿ(relates to values in Default Database Construction Properties)
Window type ÿ(relates to values in Default Database Construction Properties)
Shading system type ÿ(relates to values in Default Database Construction Properties)

column3: This database consists of a .dbf file storing thresholds of thermal comfort necessary for buildings in the zone of analysis. This database is useful to set the upper and lower limits for heating or cooling a building, as such, it is a key element of CEA.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Setpoint temperature for heating ÿsystem
Setback point of temperature for heating system
Setpoint temperature for cooling system
Setback point of temperature for cooling system
IQ requirements of indoor ventilation per person

column3: This database consists of a .dbf file storing internal thermal loads in buildings in the zone of analysis. This database is useful to calculate the heat released inside the building due to the use of appliances, people moving etc, as such, it is a key element of CEA
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Sensible heat released by occupancy at peak conditions
Moisture released by occupancy at peak conditions
Peak specific electrical ÿload due to computers and devices
Peak specific electrical ÿload due to artificial lighting
Peak specific electrical load due to industrial processes
Peak specific electrical load due to refrigeration
Peak specific electrical load due to servers/data centres
Peak specific daily hot water consumption
Peak specific fresh water consumption (includes cold and hot water)

column3: This database consists of a .dbf file storing shares of occupancy types in buildings in the zone of analysis. This database is useful to determine hourly patterns of occupancy of buildings in the area. CEA covers >15 different types of occupancy. Mix-use buildings are represented by different shares
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of hospitality area
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of coolrooms
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of parking area
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of school
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of office space
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of of gym space
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of hospital area
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of industrial area
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of retail area
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of this occupancy in the building
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of this occupancy in the building
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of this occupancy in the building
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of this occupancy in the building
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of this occupancy in the building
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of this occupancy in the building
Share (fraction of gross floor area) of this occupancy in the building
Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.

column3: This database consists of a .dbf file storing the type of heating, cooling and electrical supply systems of buildings in ÿthe zone of analysis. This database is useful to calculate the emissions due to operation of buildings and their underlying infrastructure.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Type of cooling supply system (relates to values  in Default Database LCA_infrastructure)
Type of heating supply system (relates to values  in Default Database LCA_infrastructure)
Type of hot water supply system (relates to values in Default Database LCA_infrastructure)
Type of electrical supply system (relates to inputs in Default Database LCA_infrastructure)

column3: This database consists of a .dbf file storing information of HVAC systems in buildings. This database is useful to know which type of technical system the building is using. Depending on the system, the energy demand of the building can be supplied in different ways.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Type of cooling system ÿ(relates to values in Default Database HVAC Properties)
Type of heating system ÿ(relates to values in Default Database HVAC Properties)
Type of hot water system ÿ(relates to values in Default Database HVAC Properties)
Type of heating and cooling control systems ÿ(relates to values in Default Database HVAC Properties)
Type of ventilation strategy (relates to values in Default Database HVAC Properties)

column3: This database consists of a shapefile storing the geometry of cooling networks in the surroundings of the zone of analysis. This database is useful to calculate ???
This database consists of a shapefile storing the geometry of heating networks in the surroundings of the zone of analysis. This database is useful to calculate ???

This database consists in a raster image with cells of 5m X 5m of resolution storing the elevation of the topography in m. This database is useful to calculate the solar radiation reflected to buildings.

This database consists of a .epw file storing hourly data about the weather conditions of the zone of interest. This data is useful to estimate solar radiation on site, and the conditions of temperature and humidity of the air, as such, it is a key element of CEA.
This database stores building properties of the Swiss building stock. This database  is useful to retrieve properties of buildings based on their construction year and age.
column7: Receives data from the primary input databases of ?age? and ?occupancy?. Serves to produce all secondary input databases.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Building use. It relates to the uses stored in the input database of  Zone_occupancy
Lower  limit of year interval where the building properties apply
Upper limit of year interval where the building properties apply
Letter representing whereas the field represent construction properties of a building as built ?C? or renovated ?R?
Fraction of heated space in building archetype
Window to wall ratio in building archetype
Type of construction. It relates to the contents of the default database of Envelope Properties: construction
Leakage level. It relates to the contents of the default database of Envelope Properties: leakage
Window type. It relates to the contents of the default database of Envelope Properties: windows
Roof construction. It relates to the contents of the default database of Envelope Properties: roof
Wall construction. It relates to the contents of the default database of Envelope Properties: walll
Shading system type. It relates to the contents of the default database of Envelope Properties: shade

column3: This database in Excel stores information of schedules of occupancy, and use of hot water, lighting and other electrical appliances. Every tab in this excel file corresponds to a type of occupancy. This database is useful to calculate the demand of energy in buildings.
column6: Relates detailed data to the primary input database of Zone occupancy.
column11: Unique building ID. It must start with a letter.
Probability of maximum occupancy per hour in a weekday
Probability of maximum occupancy per hour on Saturday
Probability of maximum occupancy per hour on Sunday

column3: This database in Excel stores information used to define the cooling and heating seasons for a given scenario.
column7: Note: the heating and cooling seasons need to be non-overlapping and comprise the entire year.
column11: Defines whether the scenario has a heating season.
Day on which the heating season starts
Last day of the heating season
Defines whether the scenario has a cooling season.
Day on which the cooling season starts
Last day of the cooling season

column3: This database in Excel stores information used to define the characteristics of a benchmark from which comparisons are made considering the modelled performance.
column11: Defines the function of a particular building typology.
Net real emissions
Describes the source of the benchmark standards.

column3: This database contains the schedule for various conduits, relating pipe nominal diameter (DN) to investment cost. This is helful for approximating the costs of hydraulic networks.

This database stores information for the Life Cycle Analysis of buildings due to their construction and dismantling. This database is useful to calculate the embodied emissions and grey energy of buildings.
column6: Relates detailed data to the primary input database of ?age? and ?occupancy?

column3: This database stores information for the Life Cycle Analysis of buildings due to their construction and dismantling. This database is useful to calculate the embodied emissions and grey energy of buildings.
column6: Relates detailed data to the primary input database of ?age? and ?occupancy?

column3: This database stores information for the Life Cycle Analysis of energy infrastructure in buildings and districts. This database is useful to calculate the emissions and primary energy per unit of energy consumed in the area.
column6: Relates detailed data to the primary input database of ?supply_systems?

column3: This database stores information of HVAC systems in buildings. This database is useful to calculate the performance of different HVAC systems and control systems in buildings.
column6: Relates to the primary input database of Zone HVAC

column3: This database stores information with detailed properties of components of the building envelope. This database is useful to calculate the thermal demand of energy in buildings.
column6: Relates to the primary input database of Zone architecture
column11: Description of component
Unique ID of component in the construction category
Internal heat capacity per unit of air conditioned area. Defined according to ISO 13790.

column3: This database stores information of probability density functions of several input parameters of the CEA tool. This database is useful to perform a sensitivity analysis of input parameters and to calibrate to measured data.
column6: Relates detailed data to the secondary input database of ?architecture? through the contents of the default database of ÿ?envelope_systems?. It also relates detailed data to the secondary input databases of ?internal_loads and indoor_comfort?
